element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates a density map from an input points layer. Points are weighed using a given filed from its attributes table, and that weight is applied equally to all cells within a given radius.
The following pictures show two very simple examples of how density is calculated. In both of them, there are just two input points. In the first example, however, both points have the same weight (=1), while in the second one the lower point has a weight twice the one of the upper points.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: Attribute to use for weighing points.

element.name: DISTANCE
element.text: Size of the influence area around each point. Influence area is assumed to be circular (same influence in all directions)

element.name: DENSITY
element.text: The following pictures show two examples. The search radius used in (b) is twice the one used in (a).
